records.label: Speak So Others Will Listen
records.desc: Find Your Voice. Be Heard. Learn how to boost your communication and leadership skills through vocal exercises, interactive activities, and more. Practical tools you can use immediately. Walk away with techniques to speak with confidence, command attention, and make your message memorable.

records.label: Big Brothers Big Sisters
records.desc: A public speaking and communication workshop designed to help Big Brothers Big Sisters staff effectively promote their mentoring program and services. Participants learned practical techniques to craft compelling messages, speak with confidence, and connect with potential mentors and community partners.

records.label: Telling Tales: The Art of Storytelling
records.desc: There are a lot of ways to tell stories. Find out what suits your style as we explore and learn about storytelling. Listen, learn, and share during this evening program led by Paul Ireifej.

records.label: The Future of School Leadership with AI
records.desc: We'll explore how school leaders can personally use AI to save time. You'll choose one real administrative task like newsletters or evaluation summaries and use an AI assistant to create a draft version, refining it through prompt engineering.

records.label: Teen Talk: Mastering Public Speaking for Success In-Person
records.desc: Attention Teens! Do you want to feel more confident when speaking in front of a group? Whether it's for class presentations, interviews, or leadership roles, strong public speaking skills can make a big difference. With experienced public speaker and coach, Paul Ireifej, you'll get practical tools to become a more effective and confident communicator. No prior experience needed -- just bring your voice and an open mind!

records.label: Career Day at Indian Hill
records.desc: Gave a total of seven presentations to 4, 5 and 6 grade classes at Indian Hill School during their Career Day to showcase having a job in Software Engineering and Computer Programming. This was my second year in a row doing it.

records.label: Find Your Voice with Paul Ireifej '07
records.desc:
"The human brain starts working the moment you are born and never stops until you stand up to speak in public." â€“ George Jessel

Join us for a night of dinner and gain some public speaking skills! This workshop combines interactive activities, practical exercises, and real-time feedback to help you build skills and confidence in a supportive environment of fellow alumni and friends. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your speaking abilities, this workshop is your first step to becoming a more dynamic speaker!

records.label: AI for Beginners Workshop - Red Bank
records.desc:
You're invited to join our free, one-hour workshop with seasoned speaker and tech enthusiast Paul Ireifej and receive a hands-on introduction to AI.

Discover practical and simple ways to use ChatGPT in your daily life while shedding fears and demystifying artificial intelligence. Learn how AI can simplify tasks, spark creativity, and become a helpful, approachable tool in your everyday routine.

Let's make AI work for you - no tech experience required!

records.label: AI Program with Paul Ireifej - Matawan
records.desc: Curious about AI but feeling overwhelmed? Join us for a one-hour workshop with Paul Ireifej, a seasoned speaker and tech enthusiast. Discover practical and simple ways to use ChatGPT in your daily life while shedding fears and demystifying artificial intelligence. Learn how AI can simplify tasks, spark creativity, and become a helpful, approachable tool in your everyday routine. Let's make AI work for you - no tech experience required!

records.label: Find Your Voice - Red Bank
records.desc:
Find your voice at our free workshop, hosted by experienced public speaker Paul Ireifej!

Adults and young adults are invited to join our free, one-hour workshop and discover the tools to speak with confidence, structure your message effectively, and captivate any audience.

This workshop combines interactive activities, practical exercises, and real-time feedback to help you build skills and confidence in a supportive environment. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your speaking abilities, this workshop is your first step to becoming a dynamic speaker!

records.label: Find Your Voice - Matawan
records.desc: Discover the tools to speak with confidence, structure your message effectively, and captivate any audience. In this engaging session, you'll learn how to: Craft a compelling speech with a clear, introduction, body, and conclusion, Enhance your delivery using vocal variety and powerful body language, Conquer stage fright with proven techniques like breathing exercises and visualization. This workshop combines interactive activities, practical exercises, and real-time feedback to help you build skills and confidence in a supportive environment. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your speaking abilities, this workshop is your first step to becoming a dynamic speaker!

records.label: Week of Respect - Franklin School

details.location: Franklin School in North Bergen, NJ

records.desc: The week of 10/7 is the "Week of Respect" in NJ, and Franklin School in North Bergen is looking for a volunteer speaker who can go into classrooms to speak to students grades 4 - 8 about the importance of respect, kindness, friendship, responsibility, or something that inspires them to be mindful of their actions.

records.label: Master the Art of Public Speaking - Bell Works
records.desc: Embark on a transformative journey in our "Mastering the Art of Public Speaking" workshop, featuring voluntary audience interaction with impromptu questions, examples of conststructive criticism. Discover your authentic voice, enhance public speaking skills, and gain a competitive edge. Join us for a concise, impactful session to unlock your full potential in communication and leadership.

records.label: Youth Leadership Program - Coordinator
records.desc: An 8-week youth public speaking program following Toastmasters International conventions and format. Participants learned chairmanship, introduction to public speaking, impromptu speaking, organizing your speech, listening and body gestures, and voice and vocabulary. Each one-hour session included speeches with feedback from both the instructor and peers. The program culminated in a final debate project where participants demonstrated their newly developed skills.

records.label: Career Day
records.desc: Gave a total of seven presentations to 4, 5 and 6 grade classes at Indian Hill School during their Career Day to showcase having a job in Software Engineering and Computer Programming.

records.label: Youth Leadership Program - Guest
records.desc: Gave a presentation about impromptu speaking for the Youth Leadership Program.

records.label: Master the Art of Public Speaking - Matawan
records.desc: Embark on a transformative journey in our "Mastering the Art of Public Speaking" workshop, featuring voluntary audience interaction with impromptu questions, examples of conststructive criticism. Discover your authentic voice, enhance public speaking skills, and gain a competitive edge. Join us for a concise, impactful session to unlock your full potential in communication and leadership.
